content.title: Deterministic Computation Theory
content.description: All computation in the Maven system is deterministic. Given the same inputs and state, the system will always produce the same outputs. This enables reproducibility, testing, and reliable behavior.

content.title: Modular Brain Architecture Theory
content.description: The Maven system uses a modular architecture where each brain has a single responsibility. Brains communicate via standardized message-passing interfaces. This enables flexibility, testability, and maintainability.

content.title: Memory Tier Hierarchy Theory
content.description: Maven uses a three-tier memory system: STM (short-term), MTM (mid-term), and LTM (long-term). Information flows from STM to MTM to LTM based on importance and reinforcement. Seeds always go to LTM.
